meanings.sent1: I had to rejustify my decision after new information came to light.
meanings.sent2: She needed to rejustify her actions to regain trust.
meanings.sent3: He had to rejustify his choice of ice cream flavor to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The student had to rejustify his answer when the teacher questioned it.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer had to rejustify her argument in court to win the case.

meanings.definition: To provide a new justification for something.
meanings.sent1: The company had to rejustify their pricing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: He tried to rejustify his absence from the meeting with a valid excuse.
meanings.sent3: She had to rejustify her dislike for broccoli to her mom.
meanings.sent4: The politician had to rejustify his stance on the issue to gain support.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to rejustify her hypothesis with additional data.
